localize.title: The New York Times Trends
localize.description: See what's buzzing on The New York Times in your native language

nodes.title: You can make pancakes from scratch in about as much time as it takes to make toast ğŸ¥ https://t.co/4EpwxoSl5g https://t.co/E2qUdl33eS
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: In some ways, this is the safest time to be an American teenager: drug use, drunk driving and teen pregnancy rates are all down. But a mental health crisis has emerged, with soaring rates of adolescent depression, anxiety and suicide. https://t.co/RZ9MWftZsM https://t.co/7eSGWS5pVy
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A man who set himself on fire in front of the Supreme Court on Friday in an apparent Earth Day protest against climate change has died. A friend said the self-immolation was "a deeply fearless act of compassion to bring attention to climate crisis." https://t.co/hKSt7eLETi
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin met with President Volodymyr Zelensky in Kyiv on Sunday, becoming the first senior U.S. officials known to have visited Ukraine since Russia invaded on Feb. 24. https://t.co/meZKd75HvS
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: In the shadow of a devastating war, worshipers in Kyiv, Ukraineâ€™s capital, attended services on the holiest day of the year for Orthodox Christians. https://t.co/VOuzZKOnXw https://t.co/IdgcNJ5Jck
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Twitterâ€™s board is seriously considering Elon Muskâ€™s $46.5 billion bid to buy the company, people with knowledge of the situation said. The board met on Sunday morning to discuss Muskâ€™s offer, after he began lining up financing last week. https://t.co/knjwxAOzSV
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Emmanuel Macron defeated his far-right challenger, Marine Le Pen, becoming the first French president to be re-elected since 2002. https://t.co/AbO3A2cXl6 https://t.co/7IsO3Y7fVN
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Speaking to a crowd in front of the Eiffel Tower, a solemn Emmanuel Macron acknowledged "the anger that has been expressed" during a bitter campaign against Marine Le Pen, and that he had a duty to "respond effectively" after his victory. https://t.co/cXEiII4vD1 https://t.co/8yeHHF1pi6
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Emmanuel Macron is projected to win a second term as president of France, triumphing on Sunday over Marine Le Pen, his far-right challenger. https://t.co/8iMH4J1fFs
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: In comments sections, in social media, even in the official pronouncements of the state, Ukrainians are using a new word built from several languages that is not only a condemnation of Russian actions, but also an offering to the Russian language. https://t.co/AyasKPhbfz https://t.co/ibVpWJcojB
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: American adolescence is undergoing a drastic change. Three decades ago, the gravest public health threats to teens in the U.S. came from drinking, pregnancy and smoking. These have since fallen sharply, while rates of mental health disorders are soaring. https://t.co/TUaqwHLLvH
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Mark Meadows, the final chief of staff for President Donald Trump, was told that the events of Jan. 6 could turn violent, but he pushed forward with a rally anyway, the House committee investigating the Capitol attack alleged in a court filing. https://t.co/73tjmgG48p
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A Tennessee prosecutor dropped criminal charges against a woman who was sentenced to prison after she tried to restore her right to vote. The case spurred outrage among voting rights supporters, who said it highlighted racial disparities in prosecutions. https://t.co/eVNdLxnnZF
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Senator Orrin Hatch, the Utah Republican who crusaded for right-wing causes in a seven-term career, has died. He was 88. https://t.co/L9Ny2kgXRz
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The dress worn by Judy Garland in "The Wizard of Oz" was given to a priest in 1973, but had been missing for decades when it was found in a shoe box last year. Now a university hopes to auction it off for at least $1.2 million. https://t.co/ZsRzfEspoe
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Investors and corporations are buying up houses and turning them into rental properties â€” adding obstacles to first-time home buyers. One estimate says about 2.5 million households shopping for a first home will be shut out of the market this year. https://t.co/9V5uW8D6hG
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Before the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol, Trump White House officials and members of the right-wing House Freedom Caucus strategized about a plan to direct thousands of angry marchers to the building, according to newly released testimony. https://t.co/WvbRSxZ7CR
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: About 95 percent of airline pilots in the U.S. today are male, and nearly as many are white. Now, with pilots in short supply, there's urgency for the industry to act on diversifying. https://t.co/FbavdEcsia
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: After months of begging allies to provide heavy weapons, President Volodymyr Zelensky said Saturday that his pleas were finally being answered: "We will be able to show the occupiers that the day when they will be forced to leave Ukraine is approaching." https://t.co/2Ey8cZS0Su
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said that the U.S. secretary of state, Antony Blinken, and the defense secretary, Lloyd Austin, will visit Kyiv on Sunday. https://t.co/oj1d3oeRU1
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Gerhard SchrÃ¶der has become the most prominent face of a long era of miscalculation that left Germany deeply reliant on Russian gas. He expresses no regret and has also profited handsomely from it, earning millions while promoting Russian energy interests. https://t.co/4gMhiZwkXH https://t.co/Bqhp9Y3lVJ
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Mark Meadows, Donald Trumpâ€™s former White House chief of staff, was told Jan. 6 could turn violent but pushed ahead with plans for a rally, a House panel said.
https://t.co/5nGSKsGBj9
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Japan and New Zealand opened talks on an agreement for â€œseamlessâ€ sharing of classified information, a step that could strengthen Tokyoâ€™s case to eventually join the â€œFive Eyesâ€ intelligence partnership among English-speaking powers.
https://t.co/6mc7ORuV4I
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The wider ambitions a Russian general expressed on Friday â€” to take southern Ukraine all the way to Moldova, Ukraineâ€™s southwest neighbor â€” reveal larger truths about Moscowâ€™s agenda, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said. https://t.co/dMtXcj0pze
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Florida rejected dozens of math textbooks last week. Using online sample materials provided by publishers to Florida school districts, The New York Times reviewed 21 of them to figure out why.
https://t.co/WtgqF0LDHK
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Hackers claim to have broken into dozens of Russian institutions over the past two months, including one of the Kremlinâ€™s intelligence services. https://t.co/rfaFoOIVMr
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: In a promo for a Tucker Carlson show on Fox News, a naked man atop a rock pile exposes his genitals to red light from what appears to be an air purifier, described as a treatment for a testosterone â€œcalamity.â€ An endocrinologist says it's all ridiculous. https://t.co/mgy8jcpb58
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene on Friday repeated false claims of fraud in the 2020 election as she defended her actions surrounding the Capitol riot, in an extraordinary hearing on whether she should be labeled an â€œinsurrectionistâ€ and barred from office. https://t.co/WQ2D9fHuUh
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Rep. Kevin McCarthyâ€™s false claim that he never urged Donald Trump to resign after the Capitol riot exposed the hypocrisy of Republicans who have privately scorned Trump while publicly defending him, a phenomenon widely known but seldom seen in Washington. https://t.co/ECO7XJSYGW
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
The Tennessee General Assembly became what is believed to be the first state legislature to pass a bill that would require drunken drivers to pay child support if they kill the parent of a minor.

The bill will now go to the governor for his signature.
https://t.co/75keU4IONb
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A series of satellite images show what appears to be a growing mass grave site on the outskirts of Mariupol. The holes were dug between March and April, while Russian forces were in control of the Ukrainian town, according to a New York Times analysis. https://t.co/IYUa6UUf0D https://t.co/znMTSKhozN
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
The UN detailed a â€œhorror storyâ€ of possible war crimes and abuses unfolding in Ukraine, citing indiscriminate shelling, hundreds of summary executions and the widespread devastation of civilian lives.
https://t.co/gsZRtcI5Sj
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Donald Trump Jr. has agreed to voluntarily meet with the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 Capitol attack. Texts show he encouraged White House officials to pursue â€œmultiple pathsâ€ to overturn his fatherâ€™s loss in the days after the election.
https://t.co/fmLMrcjhZm
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Thirteen female athletes who were sexually assaulted by Larry Nassar are seeking $10 million each from the FBI, alleging that agents mishandled an investigation and allowed the former sports doctor to continue abusing more victims.
https://t.co/hOuFTEz64q
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Marine Le Pen, the far-right challenger for the French presidency, is linked to President Vladimir Putin of Russia by a web of financial ties and a history of support that has hardly dimmed despite the war in Ukraine.
https://t.co/HDHGnSbAjD
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: President Biden announced another $800 million in military aid to Ukraine on Thursday, saying it sent an â€œunmistakable messageâ€ to Russiaâ€™s president, Vladimir Putin: â€œHe will never succeed in dominating and occupying all of Ukraine.â€ https://t.co/cfB0Cx5PYu https://t.co/hosUtWksgv
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
In a one-year study, people who confined a low-calorie diet to certain hours lost no more weight than those who ate at any time.

"There is no benefit to eating in a narrow window," one diet researcher said. https://t.co/SAAQ6H9Kkf
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Kevin McCarthy denied saying that he would urge Donald Trump to resign after Jan. 6, but a short audio clip tells a different story. https://t.co/VkCyEPN38j
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Florida lawmakers voted to revoke Disney Worldâ€™s special tax status, a move seen as retaliation after Disney, Floridaâ€™s largest private employer, criticized the â€œDonâ€™t Say Gayâ€ law. Gov. Ron DeSantis will almost certainly sign the measure. https://t.co/3XvCb20f7m https://t.co/fVHfWv5EJq
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Florida lawmakers voted to revoke Disney Worldâ€™s special tax status, a step seen as retaliation for Disneyâ€™s criticism of the â€œDonâ€™t Say Gayâ€ law. The move revokes a privilege that effectively allowed Disney to self-govern its theme park. https://t.co/bQ4LsCYquA
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Two men took money from donors to a project meant to help Donald Trump's border wall and spent it on jewelry, plastic surgery and a golf cart, prosecutors say. They are expected to plead guilty in Federal District Court in Manhattan, court filings show. https://t.co/3HjdDlbMQE
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Warner Bros. Discovery is shutting down CNN+. The streaming service debuted just weeks ago and was meant to bring CNN into the digital future. https://t.co/vqApzdFQvY
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Kevin McCarthy vowed to push Donald Trump to resign after Jan. 6, and Mitch McConnell said he deserved impeachment. Then their fury faded.
https://t.co/IdcrdpypFa
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Pedro SÃ¡nchez and Mette Frederiksen, the prime ministers of Spain and Denmark, arrived in Kyiv to meet with President Volodymyr Zelensky. They are the latest in a series of European leaders to visit the Ukrainian capital.

Follow our updates on Ukraine.
https://t.co/yJZTNCWch1 https://t.co/kp5zcO6nJF

nodes.title:
People have been finding hungry, scared kangaroos in forests in eastern India. 

They were almost certainly smuggled into India to be exotic pets, wildlife experts say. Some view the sightings as an example of how brazen the smuggling trade has become. https://t.co/dgfx4apYZm https://t.co/4vuJuNbKtr

nodes.title: The actor Johnny Depp took the stand for the second day on Wednesday to describe his turbulent marriage to the actress Amber Heard, whom he has sued for defamation, accusing her of â€œdemeaning name-callingâ€ that often escalated into physical violence. https://t.co/zFt6F05QZI
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: European intelligence agencies have warned about Russian spies for years. Now, an investigation in Slovakia exposed how their secret operations are trying to cause conflict in Europe and create sympathy for Moscow's war in Ukraine. https://t.co/s919IHgEs0
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
A majority of people in the U.S. favored requiring people on planes, trains and buses to wear masks, according to a new poll that was conducted in all 50 states right before a federal judge struck down the mask mandate on planes and public transit.
https://t.co/1Bb1exVIgA
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.author: The New York Times

Public health experts expressed dismay over a U.S. judgeâ€™s ruling that struck down the public transit mask mandate.

â€œIf this ruling stands, it could put the American public at great risk,â€ said Dr. Richard Besser, a former acting director of the CDC. https://t.co/eIWKZ8Zh0a

Marine Le Pen "may pretend to be a regular politician, but she remains as dangerous as ever," says Rim-Sarah Alouane, who writes about French politics, in a guest essay. "For the good of minorities and France itself, she must not prevail."
